description:
Lendio is seeking a Data Scientist in our Lehi, UT office to join an emerging leader in financial technology that uses the power of artificial technology to predict customer behaviors.

At Lendio, we’re innovative problem solvers with a passion for moving the industry forward. We have a team of talented people who enjoy coming to work every day in an established, cutting-edge company that has worked hard to maintain that start-up feel. We’re dedicated to solving difficult problems through data science and analytics. If you’ve been looking for a challenge and aren’t
satisfied with just showing up to work...Let’s talk.
About you: You like challenges. If you wake up in the middle of the night with the next great idea and can’t go back to sleep until you get a chance to write it down, you’ll fit in with us. If you get frustrated working in inefficient, top-heavy companies and want to be somewhere you can truly make a difference, we might be a good fit. You love small teams. You’d rather be on a team with 100 “A” players than 1000 corporate drones. Accountability is a term you are familiar with. You love working in a team, but also are capable of cranking out a ton of work independently.
As a Data Scientist, you will
Develop new and innovative statistical and machine learning models to predict customer behaviors leveraging Lendio’s large and complex proprietary datasets.
Evaluate potential new data sources to enhance models and decision-making.
Conduct deep dives into the performance of loans to identify data-driven opportunities to improve risk assessment.
Develop and present new strategy recommendations directly to the executive team.


Experience and Qualification
Self-starter with a proven track record of delivering high-quality analysis and models
Strong statistical and mathematical abilities and interest in finance
Expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning
Quick learner with a can-do attitude
Master’s degree in a quantitative field (statistics, math, science, engineering, economics)
Proficient in R and/or Python
Experience with object-oriented programming a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, in particular, communication of technical/quantitative concepts
Energized by an entrepreneurial environment and eager to contribute beyond your role


Benefits
Be part of a high performing, collaborative team and have fun at work each day
Competitive pay
A full suite of traditional benefits
Unlimited PTO
401k with company match and immediate vesting
Company-contributed HSA
Wellness program
And the best reason to work at Lendio is our culture! Check us out on @LendioLife and Glassdoor

#General
#LI-CY1

Requisition ID: 21013422
Category: Research and Sciences
Location: Roy - UT, United States of America
Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship
Clearance Type: Secret
Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position
Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America)
Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time
Positions Available: 2



At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Embark on a career putting innovative, reliable, and agile products and ideas into orbit, and beyond. Northrop Grumman has opportunities waiting for you that play a vital role in human space exploration, national defense, and scientific discovery, supporting multiple programs across the universe. With us, you’ll discover a culture of curiosity and collaboration that will have you Defining Possible from the day you start. Our space systems connect and protect millions of people on earth every day, now and for the future. Explore your future and launch your career today.Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking a Principal Data Scientist. This position will be located in Roy, Utah and will support the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program. This role may offer a competitive relocation assistance package.As a full-time employee of Northrop Grumman Space Systems, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including:

Medical, Dental & Vision coverage
401k
Educational Assistance
Life Insurance
Employee Assistance Programs & Work/Life Solutions
Paid Time Off
Health & Wellness Resources
Employee Discounts This position’s standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off. What You’ll Get To Do: Create data mining architectures/models/protocols, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets. Analysis may have ma ny applications such as to address a business issue or provide a competitive advantage for the organization. Requires strong statistical and data visualization skills. In addition, you will: - Develop and implement artificial intelligence and machine learning models to solve complex data problems - Interpret large amounts of data using advanced visualization techniques and tools. - Merge and transform big datasets to ensure data integrity and usability. - Develop a process to maintain quality and performance of statistical models and quickly identify enhancements opportunities. - Communicate advanced concepts and information in an understandable manner for audiences of varying levels of competency. - Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of technology trends. - Properly document code, artifact description, implementation, and use case. - Work on a fast pasted collaborative team in an agile environment.Basic Qualifications:
5 Years experience with a Bachelors in Science; 3 Years with a Masters.
Programming experience in Python, R, or Node.js.
Experience manipulating dataframes through SQL, pandas, or tidyverse - US Citizen with ability to obtain a Secret clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with any of the following: Tensorflow, Theano, Keras, PyTorch, NLTK, PyStan, PyMC3, Rstan, ElasticSearch, PyCuda
Familiarity with Graph, NoSQL, Hadoop, SMACK, or Neo4J/OWL




Salary Range: 96140 - 144210



Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.



Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Senior Azure DevOps Architect
About us

Redpoint Global is the leading, enterprise grade marketing platform. Some of the biggest companies in the world are driving board level revenue generation from our rgOne platform.

rgOne™, Redpoint Global’s fully integrated solution, delivers a single point of control for data management, analytics, and marketing execution, so your customers can receive the real-time, hyper-personalized experiences they demand.

Website

https://www.redpointglobal.com

Background:

Smart marketers know that their insights and decisions are only as good as the models on which they’re built. That’s why Redpoint Automated Machine Learning (AML) helps your team analyze, build, use, and optimize models based on your business goals.

AML unites marketers, data scientists and engineers to render advanced modeling an easy, smooth process. Working with your data and your orchestration engine, AML makes real time and batch decisions to advance a broad range of business goals, including churn prediction, offer optimization, intent understanding, and more.

We have so much more to go in this journey both in terms of features and performance. We need a strong candidate to lead the way.

Responsibilities:

The Senior Data Scientist will review and test existing data models to check for accuracy and performance. Propose new models or enhancements to existing models that improve accuracy and performance. Work closely with the Engineering team to guide implementation of ML code changes.

Review and test existing productized models.
Propose novel changes in models to improve accuracy and performance.
Provide detailed guidance (code samples or pseudocode) for new models or algorithm changes for Engineering team use
Collaborate with product owners, designers, and other dev team members
Participate in all scrum activities

Who We're Looking For:

5+ years of data science, machine learning, advanced analytics
Extensive experience in applying Data Science / ML in production to build data-driven products for solving business problems
Strong coding skills in general purpose languages (Java/Python) and familiarity with software engineering principles around testing, code reviews, and deployment. Bonus points for C++ background.
Strong knowledge of common clustering, classification, and regression models.
Experience collaborating and understanding needs of various stakeholders (Product Management and Engineering)
MS or PH.D in quantitative fields (e.g. Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Professional development assistance
Referral program
Vision insurance

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Full COVID vaccinations required, additional office safety protocols in place at office locations.

Application Question(s):

Please provide examples of 3 specific business problems solved with your analytical solutions and discuss both approach and outcomes. Please, no company names or confidential information.

Education:

Master's (Required)

Experience:

Data science: 5 years (Required)
Machine learning: 5 years (Required)
C++: 3 years (Preferred)
Product development: 3 years (Required)
Python: 5 years (Required)

Work Location:

Fully Remote

Work Location: Remote

Company Description


Measured Analytics and Insurance is a high-growth Insurtech based in Salt Lake City, Utah. We're building smarter cyber insurance products designed specifically for the future of digital risk powered by artificial intelligence and machine learning. At Measured, we passionately believe in the power of data to drive better outcomes for our customers.



Job Description


We're looking for a Junior Data Scientist who will join our Data Science team that is building the best-in-class cyber insurance risk modeling platform. The ideal candidate will have education or equivalent professional experience in analyzing large data sets, familiarity with different ML modeling techniques, and hands-on experience with ML frameworks and libraries. If you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, we want to talk to you.

The things we'd like you to do:

Build tools to automate data collection and set up data pipelines that populate our Data Lake

Assist in tuning and validation of cyber-insurance risk models

Create reports and data visualizations to present analytic results

Research new data sets and modeling techniques to improve our predictive modeling efficacy



Qualifications


BS/MS in Data Science or equivalent experience

Experience working with Machine Learning software and languages including Python, Jupyter notebooks, and ML/Data Analytics libraries

Working knowledge of Data Engineering tools on AWS such as Glue, Athena, S3

Familiarity with Agile software development process


Additional Information


Get in on the ground floor of a new & growing company.

Significant career advancement opportunities in an expanding operation.

The chance to have direct input on shaping company strategy and direction

Autonomy while being supported by skilled teammates

Competitive salary and equity grants

Ability to work remotely

As much as you’re a master at rigorous mining, culling and interpretation of big data, you’re equally at task to glean small but meaningful data insights and making it pop in multiple data visualization platforms.

ABOUT US
We create global impact by combining impact investing & innovative finance, data science, policy
entrepreneurship, community engagement, and impact storytelling. This Sorenson Impact Methodology™ translates inspiration into impact and helps social entrepreneurs and organizations articulate, measure, and expand their impact. Students are integrated into all our work. We operate an impact investing practice for our own fund and as a manager of an outside fund; we annually host one of the largest gatherings in the impact space; we have a thriving Data, Policy and Performance Innovation advisory practice and a world-class creative shop.

The Sorenson Impact Center strongly encourages diverse applicants (please circulate widely), especially those who self-identify as Black, Native or Indigenous, People of Color, LGBTQIA+, non-binary, living with disabilities, neurodivergent, young, speak English as a second language, and others from overlooked / underestimated communities.

Job Overview:
Conducts advanced statistical analyses of qualitative and quantitative data and interprets results. Works on independent projects as part of the data team and applies appropriate data science techniques to provide insights and answers to social impact issues. Effectively communicates data analyses to a variety of audiences, both technical and non-technical.

Responsibilities

1. Oversees/conducts statistical analyses, employing methods of descriptive statistics, multivariate analysis, regression analysis, and other statistical modeling techniques appropriate for the client’s needs.
2. Formats data for statistical analysis.
3. Presents statistical findings to a lay audience.
4. Writes reports and creates dashboards and data visualizations for clients.
5. May devise methods and procedures for collecting data.
6. May travel to a variety of sites within and outside the University to coordinate projects.
7. May supervise junior staff/students.

This job description is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.

Work Environment and Level of Frequency that may be required

Nearly Continuously: Office environment.

Physical Requirements and Level of Frequency that may be required

Nearly Continuously: Sitting, hearing, listening, talking.

Often: Repetitive hand motion (such as typing), walking.

Seldom: Bending, reaching overhead.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalency; plus four years related research experience, and demonstrated human relation and effective communication skills also required.

A Master’s degree in a related field is preferred.

Applicants must demonstrate the potential ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined in the position description.

Preferences

Preference will be given to candidates who exhibit the following:

Experience in managing projects among diverse stakeholders.
A degree in data science, statistics, business, public policy, or a related field. Master’s or PhD preferred.
Data engineering or analysis experience required.
Strong analytical, writing, and communication skills.
Proficiency in a programming language, such as R or Python (R preferred).
Type Benefited Staff Special Instructions Summary

Qualis Corporation is seeking an experienced Statistician/Data Scientist to support test documentation and data collection services for the West Desert Test Center (WDTC) at Dugway Proving Ground (DPG), UT. This is a full-time position.

Essential Functions

Work closely with the Government POC and the customer to identify the appropriate statistical and visualization analysis for each project.
Using supporting data and analysis, the Statistician/Data Scientist will provide technical guidance and recommendations to test directors and other test team members throughout WDTC for development of test design plans; data collection, reduction and analysis plans; test methodology; and final report preparation.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in statistics or data science and 3-5 years minimum experience.
Demonstrated experience in task management and interpersonal communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to be innovative and adapt to changing program and customer requirements.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Have a strong statistical background and be responsible for the development of R and/or Python code supporting statistical and graphical analyses.
Demonstrated skill in providing high-level briefings.
Demonstrated experience in physical sciences, chemical sciences, biological sciences, or engineering, with experience in design and analysis of field tests, physical laboratory tests, and/or chemical warfare/CB development.
Chemical or biological laboratory experience is also desirable.

Clearance

Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret security clearance.



Equal Opportunity Employer/M/F/Vet/Disabled and a Participant in E-Verify

ReliaQuest is looking for passionate Data Science professionals to join our team. This role will drive the creation, testing and deployment of cutting edge security technology to enterprise customers across the globe. You will build, design, and get tools to market tht will mature and advance the information security field. It is a great opportunity to advance your career in a fast-growing organization by creating new services/capabilities that do not exist today in the Cyber Security industry.

Responsibilities:

Select and engineer features from a wide variety of data sets
Build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques
Processing, cleaning, and verifying the integrity of the data used for analysis
Creating anomaly detection systems and tracking their performance
Integrate model inference into multiple diverse data pipelines
Perform code reviews and mentor peers

Qualifications:

Understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with common data science toolkits
Knowledge of Sagemaker,Apache Spark, Tensorflow, Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter Notebooks, Keras
Practical experience using NLP
Proficiency in creation of dashboards and visualizations
Knowledge of a combination of the following scripting and programming languages: Java, C, C++, C#, Python, Javascript, R
Preferred experience with Elasticsearch, GPU accelerated operations,log ingestion
Demonstrable mastery of statistics. Additional skills in linear algebra and/or calculus beneficial
Bachelor’s in Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, Physics (or Equivalent Experience)

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Multiple Locations

At MarketDial we equip our clients with the easiest-to-use and most accurate solution to conduct offline A/B testing. In short, we provide our clients with the tools they need to set up statistically robust trials to test various initiatives across their business. This allows them to learn quickly and have greater confidence in the initiatives they ultimately decide to roll out - saving time, money, and energy. To date, our software has allowed our clients across the retail, grocery, c-store, restaurant, and manufacturing markets to make sophisticated multi-million dollar marketing, pricing, staffing, and operational decisions through offline A/B testing.

We pride ourselves on offering our clients unparalleled support to ensure their success with MarketDial. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist to uniquely support our clients in the U.S. and abroad.

Job description:

This role has a variety of responsibilities spanning engagement with MarketDial users and senior executives/project sponsors. A sample of responsibilities include:

Support users in end to end process of testing, from designing the ideal test to meet their business need, to understanding the business implications of the test outcome
Analyze data and create novel analytical solutions to answer business questions
Host regular training sessions to equip new users with the skills to effectively use MarketDial
Research statistical/ML methodologies to solve client problems and develop the MarketDial product
Engage key stakeholders to increase MarketDial awareness across business units, including promoting MarketDial at various business town halls
Strategize with senior leaders to embed MarketDial into the broader testing governance/framework of their business
Onboard new teams/brands through effective collaboration with project sponsors and technical stakeholders
Effectively gather user feedback to understand opportunities to enhance our product, and work with the MarketDial leadership team to incorporate feedback into product development
Produce high quality materials (powerpoint, etc.) to engage with clients (users and senior executives) on test outcomes and broader partnership objectives

The ideal candidate should:

Be comfortable working and communicating with senior executives as well as business analysts
Be knowledgeable in applying of statistical and ML methodologies using tools like Python to solve real-world problems
Be able to work independently and drive projects with limited direction (be comfortable with being uncomfortable)
Be open to travel as needed to meet client needs

Nice to have:

A background in retail analytics or management consulting is preferred but not required
Experience with/technical skills of Python, SQL, R, SAS, or the likes is highly desirable
An advanced degree (Ph'D, Masters) in an analytical discipline is preferred but not required
Adept with translating concepts and analytics into an effective presentation appropriate for various audiences
Project management experience or skills highly desirable

Some of the benefits you will enjoy:

Competitive pay and stock option grants.
Fully-covered healthcare, as well as a company-funded HRA account to pay for all out of pocket costs.
Unlimited vacation policy.
Generous parental leave.
Regular free meals.
Fully stocked kitchen.
Open, transparent office and culture.
Continuing education/tuition reimbursement program.
Transportation benefits and reimbursement program.

Data Scientist will be located in the Salt Lake City, Utah area and report to the Chief Data Scientist who sits in SLC.

job_title: Data Engineer - AI and Data Operations - Remote
description:
If you are a current employee who is interested in applying to this position, please navigate to the internal Careers site to apply.

Data Engineer - AI and Data Operations - Remote

Location: Remote

About MarketStar:
Rated as one of the Salt Lake Tribune’s Top Workplaces in 2019 and 2020, MarketStar is one of Northern Utah’s largest private employers and has offices in Ogden, Salt Lake City, and Dublin, Ireland. Our employees have helped launch, sell, and support thousands of products and services on behalf of the biggest and brightest companies in the world!

We are excited to have you apply to work with us! “You Belong” is one of the MarketStar values and we look forward to you finding belonging and purpose here with us. Another MarketStar value is “We Care” which means that we care about you, your career and your family. We look forward to the possibility of having you on our team!

MarketStar Benefits and Perks:
• Childcare Reimbursement – 50% up to $5000 annually
• Healthcare Coverage: Medical, dental, vision (First day of following month)
• 401k Match: 100% pre-tax match on the first 3%, 50% pre-tax match on the following 2%
• Paid Time Off: 4.5 weeks total PTO + 7 Paid Holidays
• Paid Family Maternity/Paternity Leave: Up to 6 weeks (eligible after 1 year of employment)
• Tuition Reimbursement: $2,000 semi-annually ($4,000 aggregated over a full calendar year)
• 0% interest Hardship Loan Program

About the Data Engineer - AI and Data Operations - Remote

The AI and Data Operations team is responsible for providing accurate, timely, well-structured data to AI Engineers, Business Intelligence Engineers, and management teams. As a Data Engineer, you will build and maintain data repositories, custom workflows, data integrations, and imports. You will work closely with Business Intelligence and AI Engineers to create shared data models they can use to drive value for the business.

What will you do?

Monitor data processes, workflows, and jobs, and address any issues that arise
Leverage SQL, Python, Azure tools, PowerBI, and other technologies to extract, transform, and load data into well-designed data models
Understand and follow all rules and procedures required by security and best practice policies
Document data models and software, and clearly communicate current state and changes to the teams that use them
Document metadata in a centralized repository in a way that allows us to maximize the value of the data we manage
Work with public and private APIs, file stores, databases, and other repositories to enhance and expand data capabilities
Write highly resilient, high throughput data workflows with solid logging and process monitoring
Import and integrate data into front line systems for MarketStar corporate and client teams
Actively engage with the team while working in a remote environment, working to deliver an excellent level of service to all consumers of the data
Create and maintain highly reliable APIs that expose data and AI services to other teams
Constantly improve yourself and the team through training and sharing of best practices
Understand MarketStar’s business processes and make suggestions on data services that could drive value for the business

Desired Attributes for Success:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar field
A willingness to learn new tools and technologies
Experience querying data using the SQL language
Experience working with data using the Python language
Experience creating and sharing data models/data marts/data warehouses
Experience working with APIs
A high-level understanding of sales processes and tools
Solid communication skills with experience translating complex technical processes or problems to non-technical language
Experience in measuring, reporting, and analysis of processes
Understanding of agile project/task management techniques


MarketStar does not discriminate in any aspect of employment based on race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where MarketStar does business.

Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home.
At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts.

What does a Data Scientist do at Swire Coca-Cola?

As Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting world-class data science and advanced analytics inclusive of modeling and AI/ML techniques across all channels, customer and consumer segments, markets, and products/categories. This role drives business value via actionable analytics in conjunction with Insight Strategy and Execution team.

Key Responsibilities:

Conducts analysis of data to identify insights and actions that could benefit or mitigate potential risks to the business.
Develop predictive models via machine learning methodologies for customer and consumer insights; leverage analytics to provide input into a clear, relevant, actionable, measurable, trusted view of the customer and consumer to support business needs.
Understands and can communicate the effects of decisions to the business. Anticipates and explains the effects of decisions to inform business-facing team and influence key business partners.
Understands the business and prioritizes analytics needs including allocating resources, funds and vets proposed analysis for high-impact or substantial projects affecting the capability. Manages business expectations around prioritization and provides transparency to the process.
Executes work effectively using established key processes.
Maintains effective relationships with the key stakeholders and participants. Understands the dynamics of the processes and interests of the involved parties to reach effective agreements and resolutions.
Understands key performance metrics (e.g., revenue and margin growth, consumer loyalty improvements and process and execution efficiencies).
Qualifications:

Advanced degree in STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics or related field required
8 years' experience in analytics, business, or related area
4 years' project management experience
4 years' analytics, statistics and/or database knowledge and experience (using tools, applications, platforms, etc.)
2 years' executive leadership experience in a consumer insights function for a global consumer-oriented organization in retail, distribution, manufacturing, or a related industry preferred
World class predictive analytics skillset including modeling, AI/ML, programming skills, and other advanced techniques. Understands and effectively utilizes analytics systems, databases, and tools.
Proficient in R, Python, SQL, or other programming language(s)
Ability to identify new issues, trends, and opportunities from data
Written and verbal communication skills
Strong customer service orientation
Up to 25% travel with overnight stays
Swire Coca-Cola, USA is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

What makes us Qlik

Qlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. A Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for 11 years in a row! Our platform is the only one on the market that allows for open-ended, curiosity-driven exploration, giving everyone – at any skill level – the ability to make real discoveries that lead to real outcomes and transformative changes. We are a Values-Driven organization, operating over 100 countries with 45,000 customers around the world. If you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you!


Senior Software Engineer, Data Scientist




Join the team responsible for designing, creating, building, delivering and maintaining our AutoML platform, along with the infrastructure environment to support it. We are looking for a creative, motivated and dedicated individual with technical aptitude to join us in a Data Scientist and Software Engineer position to further the evolution of our world-class supervised machine learning platform The day-to-day work of this role is primarily software engineering; that is the nature of building a software platform. However, this role also requires a significant understanding of data science and machine learning fundamentals, tools, and best practices to ensure that features of the platform are implemented well. The successful candidate will have a strong analytical and mathematical background coupled with excellent communication and outstanding teamwork skills.

Responsibilities include:
Working on the engineering team to help build the next generation of the company’s web services.
Learning quickly while utilizing new tools/languages/frameworks/patterns/etc.
Providing guidance on both software and product solutions on the application of statistics and machine learning.


Qualifications include:

Bachelor of Science degree in mathematics, statistics, engineering, data science, or equivalent. Master’s degree preferred.
4 + years in data science with a strong understanding of supervised machine learning.
Great communication, attitude, and teamwork skills.
Able to communicate machine learning concepts and help make pragmatic decisions.
Proficiency in Python.
Familiarity with event-driven software.
SQL Experience.
Familiarity with GoLang, an asset.
Proficiency of the application of machine learning libraries and packages (ex. Pandas, scikit-learn).
Proficiency of the machine learning lifecycle: Problem framing, Data ingestion, Data preparation, Model fitting, Model assessment, Model application, Operationalization of results.


Location
The role is located in Salt Lake City, UT.


About Qlik
Qlik Company Page – Who we are!
Our Values at Qlik: Challenge, Take Responsibility, Move Fast, Be Open and Straightforward
Competitive Benefits package
Flexible working environment
Giving back is a part of our culture – we give you a day to change the world. In addition, we encourage our employees to participate in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs

WE ARE
We are Black Rifle Coffee Company, a veteran-owned company serving premium coffee to people who love America. We have a love for coffee, dogs, the outdoors, America, and most importantly, our customers! We are more than a product and more than a company; we are a culture. A culture full of motivated men and women who roll up their sleeves and get the job done with integrity, love, innovation, and radical transparency. Join us as we take action on our commitment to provide quality coffee and give back to the veteran and first responder communities and those who support it.
THE ROLE
Black Rifle Coffee Company is looking to bring on a Data Scientist. We are looking for a driven, ambitious individual who wants to create a career developing high impact analysis and solutions.
YOUR TASK

Develop predictive models for customer acquisition, retention, cross-sell, lifetime value and marketing spend optimization
Implement models on CRM platforms for marketing, ecommerce and customer contact efforts. Work closely with business owners to meet their requirements and ensure models are being used properly.
Monitor model performance to verify algorithms are providing expected lift
Collect, synthesize, and analyze data from multiple sources
Identify data and software needs. Drive customer data platform initiatives to optimize environment for analytics
Document queries, processes, and information assets
Identify and work to resolve any data quality issues
Help with a variety of other projects including customer analytics, subscription analytics, forecasting and reporting. This position will flex into multiple areas as needed.

YOUR EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
Master’s in Data Analytics or similar quantitative field preferred
1+ year of demonstrated data science experience
Python / R / SQL experience required
Familiarity with analytic or cloud platforms such as BiqQuery, AWS or Azure
Proficient in creating reports and visualizations. Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio (or similar).
Proficient in Google suite of products (Sheets, Slides, etc.) or similar.
Ability to multi-task and take initiative, working both individually and as part of a team
Ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences is critical
Experience working with eCommerce, Customer Contact or Marketing data preferred

YOUR BENEFITS
Competitive Pay-
Comprehensive medical, dental & vision package

Department: Biocomputing - 331

Primary Purpose:

The Research Data Scientist develops methods and tools for gathering, storing, manipulating, analyzing, and displaying research and clinical data. The position supports design and implementation of tools and process analyses from a variety of research and clinical testing methods with the goal to advance the state-of-the-art in clinical diagnosis, treatment, data analysis, and reporting. This position will address the critical needs of research and clinical organizations seeking scalability and flexibility for a variety of applications in the field of laboratory medicine.

About ARUP:

ARUP Laboratories is a national clinical and anatomic pathology reference laboratory and an enterprise of the University of Utah and its Department of Pathology. Based in Salt Lake City, Utah.

ARUP proudly hires top talent to create a work environment of diversity, professional growth and continuous development. Our workforce is committed to the important service we provide to over one million patients each month. We always strive for excellence and have a strong desire to have involvement with the advances in medicine and the role laboratory services plays within each patient’s life. We never forget that there is a patient behind every specimen we receive.

We are looking for individuals who want to contribute to ARUP's culture of accountability, integrity, service, and excellence. Consider joining our dynamic team.

Essential Functions:

Creates, refines and validates software, data analysis processes, statistical, and data visualization tools.

Implements and maintains computational tools for data mining and data integration.

Develops enhanced data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems and reporting clinical results.

Develops new tools to aid in the analysis of assay quality metrics, interpretation, and reporting.

Develops novel methods/algorithms, and extends, adapts and improves existing methods as needed.

Develops analysis approaches in support of clinical applications.

Works effectively with other scientists, programmers, engineers, and researchers to implement novel or adapt existing approaches to data analysis and reporting.

Supports transition of developed software and analysis into clinical practice.

Provides consultative support to clinical and research staff, pathology residents, Medical Directors and others as assigned.

Other duties as assigned.

Physical and Other Requirements:

Stooping: Bending body downward and forward by bending spine at the waist.

Reaching: Extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction.

Mobility: The person in this position needs to occasionally move between work sites and inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.

Communicate: Frequently and effectively communicate with others.

PPE: Biohazard laboratory environment that requires use of personal protective equipment in accordance with CDC and OSHA regulations and company policies.

ARUP Policies and Procedures: To conduct self in compliance with all ARUP Policies and Procedures.

Sedentary Work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.

Job Description:

PharmScript is one of the nation’s leading pharmacies, partnering with long-term and post- acute care facilities to supply medications to thousands of residents and patients. When you join the PharmScript family, you join the ranks of more than 1,700 dedicated people across the country who help to get safe, accurate, and timely medication to those who need it most.

We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our PharmScript team within our Continuous Improvement department. As the Data Scientist, the ideal candidate will leverage the disparate datasets, ensuring data integrity and quality, creating innovative solutions and providing operational insights to improve quality, service and customer experience. The ideal candidate will have experience with database technologies, operational analytics, working knowledge of Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) techniques.

This role will require deep acquaintance with PharmScript's data, including but not limited to patient, payor, claims, and dispensing. You will play a key role in ensuring data integrity, accuracy and quality as the foundation for PharmScript’s data-centric AI journey. You will collaborate with internal customers to design, develop, validate, implement, maintain, enhance and support analytical and machine learning models to deliver actionable insights that can be incorporated into business strategies and program development. The ideal candidate for this role will have strong coding skills, a passion for creating technology to improve health care, an attitude of creativity and continual learning and a desire to teach others.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders, both technical and non-technical, throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Perform data acquisition and data transformation in support of AI/ML projects
Develop analytical and machine learning models based on patient, payor, claims, and dispensing data to deliver business insights.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and be responsible for implementing robust testing strategies leading to model optimization.
Assess the integrity, accuracy and quality of data sources and data collection techniques.
Define the data science development workflows from coding and architecture best practices, data strategy, to ML training and Inference platforms.
Keep up to date, latest developments in AI/ML and incorporate these in our best practices.
Develop presentations around insights to be delivered to business users at all levels: strategic, tactical, operational, and across functions.
Ensure that AI/ML deliverables can be productionized and integrated into existing systems, processes and application development.
Analyze and evaluate large quantities of data in relational databases and unstructured forms of data, effectively balancing quality, availability and timeliness.
Assist various departments with evaluating AI/ML solutions or software capabilities on the market.

Qualifications:

Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or a relevant field required.
2+ years of experience in building, training and deployment of AI/ML models including deep learning.
2+ years of experience in database and data modeling design, data quality principles, source file data extraction, complex data transformation and load processes.
2+ years’ experience in systems analysis, data analysis and requirements gathering in healthcare industry experience is preferred.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.) to manipulate data, develop analytical models and draw insights from large datasets.
Demonstrated experience with the lifecycle development process for AI and ML models including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging, implementation and support.
Experience with cloud AI/ML platform such as AWS, Google Cloud or Azure preferred.
Experience with collaborating with cross functional teams and stakeholders within a division and enterprise-wide to evaluate new AI/ML opportunities.
Thorough understanding of how to interpret operational data and translate business needs into technical design and requirements.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of peers, managers, executives, and subject matter experts to uncover and effectively present insights that inform strategic decisions.
Have capability and desire to mentor others and educate business users on AI/ML knowledge.
Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment, learn quickly, solve problems and make decisions with minimal supervision.
Solid project management skills and capability of managing multiple deliverables and meet deadlines.

EEO Statement:

PharmScript is fully committed to employing a diverse workforce. We recruit and retain talented individuals without regard to gender, race, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation and gender identity or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

EO/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

This role is onsite in Florham Park, NJ.

As a Data Scientist in PCS Wireless’ Data, Analytics and Reporting team, you’ll get to build pricing analysis using scores of data from multiple data sources, analyze real business issues, dive into 1,000s of SKUs to improve inventory, margins and help drive the most critical KPIs of the business.

About You

You are a problem solver excited to take on complex data challenges. You love learning new technologies almost as much as you love mastering those you already know. You thrive in environments where data leads, the customers are global, and the stakes are high. You choose to work where you can get your hands dirty and make a real impact.

About Us

PCS Wireless is the global leader in the secondary market for connected devices. PCS Wireless partners with manufacturers, operators, distributors, service centers, and retailers to turn inventory challenges into business opportunities. We specialize in the responsible and profitable redistribution of new and pre-owned phones, tablets, accessories, and other wireless equipment. PCS Wireless’ partners leverage our Asset Recovery, Buyback Programs, OEM Value Added Distribution, Open Market Programs, Device Services and Device Diagnostics to improve their bottom line.

About the role

Reporting to the Controller, Data, Analytics and Reporting, you will build data models that drive pricing floors, profitability analysis, inventory depreciation regressions, customer and supplier analysis:

Analyze SKUs to determine depreciation rates and primary depreciation drivers.
Project pricing floors for inventory management leveraging existing sales, auction and third-party data sources coupled with depreciation rates, predicted turns and cost of capital.
Perform supplier analysis to determine most valuable supplier sources.
Create customer models to inform sales teams of highest margin / SKU sales opportunities by customer, geography, sector
Implement continuous data enhancement models to improve prediction accuracy.
Build out AI/RPA platforms

What you need

Self-starter & Independent critical thinker
BSc or higher in statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a similar field
3+ years’ data science experience, using BI tools, data mining, and statistics
Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL queries
Working experience with a Business Intelligence tool such as PowerBI or Tableau
Working experience with a Data Intelligence tool such as Alteryx
Proficiency in Python, R, or other data manipulation or analysis languages
Working experience with Azure/AWS or other cloud service

WHO WE ARE:
Founded by Josh Harris and David Blitzer, Harris Blitzer Sports & Entertainment (HBSE) includes in its portfolio the Philadelphia 76ers, the New Jersey Devils, leading venue Prudential Center in Newark, N.J., the GRAMMY Museum Experience Prudential Center, the Delaware Blue Coats, the Binghamton Devils, the Sixers Innovation Lab Crafted by Kimball, and renowned esports franchise Dignitas. Led by some of the best and brightest minds across a diverse spectrum of industries, HBSE positions itself as one of the most pioneering, innovative global sports and entertainment businesses to date. HBSE also strives to positively impact the local communities in which it operates through the powerful platform of sports.
HBSE offers an energetic work environment built on collaboration, growth, and a quest to excel in everything we do. Prudential Center in downtown Newark, N.J. hosts more than 175 concerts, family shows and special events annually and is the fourth-ranked sports and entertainment venue in the U.S. by Pollstar and Billboard. It is home to the New Jersey Devils, a renowned NHL franchise with three Stanley Cup championships and a proud, passionate fan base. Prudential Center is also home to the brand-new GRAMMY Museum Experience, the first and only of its kind on the east coast.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY:
At HBSE, we engage, represent and reflect diverse voices of employees, players fans and communities. We are dedicated to hiring the best talent that is reflective of where we live, work and play – across all groups and levels; supporting and developing every employee to reach their potential; and creating an inclusive environment that allows team members to bring their true authentic selves to work.

Philadelphia 76ers
The Philadelphia 76ers organization is one of the most storied franchises in American sports, led by some of the best and brightest minds across a diverse spectrum of industries, HBSE positions itself as one of the most pioneering, innovative global sports and entertainment businesses to date. The 76ers have attracted the industry’s top leadership talent from the NBA, NFL, NHL, MLB, MLS, UFC and NCAA, resulting in one of the most exciting, rewarding, and dynamic work environments within the sports industry. The 76ers offer a best-in-class workplace culture built on collaboration, growth, and a quest to excel in everything we do.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Scientist will work in the Research and Development team within the front office of the Philadelphia 76ers, supporting basketball decision-making at all levels: front office, coaching, scouting, sports science and training. A successful applicant will have a strong technical foundation and be passionate about better understanding the game of basketball using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT AREN'T LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:
Exploit complex player-tracking datasets, turning data into basketball concepts and insights
Develop statistical models to accurately evaluate and forecast player and team performance
Apply data-driven research to advance strategic thought within the organization
QUALIFICATIONS:
2+ years of experience in research-oriented academic or industry setting
Strong understanding of statistics (estimation theory, hypothesis testing, experimental design)
Direct experience applying and evaluating supervised and unsupervised learning techniques, e.g. regression models, decision trees, neural networks, and clustering methods
Fluent in one or more programming languages (Python preferred)
Experience working with SQL
Demonstrated passion for basketball

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Digital Health department. Remote work is available.

Schedule:Monday-Friday, 8:00am-5:00pm. possible field travel as wells as occasional overnight travel for required meetings and/or industry meetings.

BioReference is at the forefront of healthcare’s digital transformation. Our Digital Health services include Scarlet, which reimagines the delivery of health care, creating an accessible, consumer-centric approach to the way patients receive laboratory services. Scarlet provides a much-needed service that is efficient, secure, convenient, flexible, digitally enabled and easy to use, providing access to a variety of tests, from COVID-19 to chronic conditions, and more.

As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for harnessing the millions of data points we receive from clients and patients, such as ordering patterns and patient results, to improve patient care by delivering actionable insights and analysis. A Data Scientist works with business owners, Project Managers, Program Managers, and Business Analysts to understand the objectives of the business owner, retrieval of data, organization of data into information, interpretation of data and its meaning and the ultimate conclusion of business directives derived from the analytical activities.

You will collaborate closely with our commercial and operations teams to optimize their efforts to efficiently enable hospitals & physicians to improve clinical care and shorten the diagnostic journey. Additionally, your analyses will help scale our Scarlet service and drive utilization within market regions and clients. For the right candidate the position offers enormous potential and the chance of being part of a growing digital health care service.

Essential Functions of this Role


Discover, understand, and organize disparate data sources and structure them into clean data models that unlock analytics for commercial, operational, technical teams
Empower our operations and commercial teams with the insights and tools they need to best serve our customers and scale the business efficiently
Gather and analyze health, social, and utilization data to build models to find the best way to close gaps in care
Translate operational business needs into information requirements - documenting those requirements that can be met and identifying those that represent gaps in our data sources.
Explore and introduce new data driven approaches to generate business insights in order to address unanswered business problems. Expertly understands and incorporates analytics best practices and keeps on top of emerging tools and practices
Validate, interpret and present data findings to key stakeholders. Translate data analysis into a meaningful story that explain nuance and complexity, and inspires action
Skills and Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience; Master’s Degree preferred
Experience with data analysis, database querying, and data science tools (SQL, Python, etc); Demonstrated experience with relational databases and understanding of potential causes of data quality issues
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; including interacting with people at all levels of the organization to ensure open information gathering and feedback to analysis
Experience with CRM tools; SalesForce preferred
Experience of using data visualization tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, etc.); PowerBI preferred
Healthcare experience (in health plan or in provider setting) preferred

Measure promotional uplift and the uplift of marketing activities more generally.

As a Data Scientist,

You will be working with product owners, program managers, developers, business stakeholders, and executives to deeply understand customer problems and priorities.
You will lead cross-functional projects by applying your analysis techniques to create advanced data modeling and discover insights. These insights that will be foundations for strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.
You will dive into various datasets, becoming a subject matter expert on the data generated by and used by our User Experience, Product, Client onboarding, Support, and service teams. Your expertise will be catalyst to growth.

Analytical skills - Knowledge of data & analytics. Ability to work independently on analytical tasks.

Communication-Ability to think quickly & relay information to technical and non-technical audiences. A strong bias towards delivering results while dealing with ambiguity in fast-paced, dynamic environments.

Essential Function
The Divisional Statistician/Data Analyst is responsible for updating and maintaining all statistical records and reports for the New Jersey Division. This position will also seek to turn raw data collected into organized and insightful information, to be used by corps and DHQ departments.

Duties and Responsibilities

The duties listed below are the primary duties of this position but are not all the duties that may be required.
The Salvation Army reserves the right to change, reduce or expand the duties of this position at any time.

Specifically, the primary duties are: .

Generate all statistical reports from Corps monthly.
Prepare necessary reports and transfer statistical information to THQ monthly or as needed.
Review all monthly statistics; generate departmental reports as requested.
Coordinate statistical and membership roll training for Field Officers as needed.
Maintain open communication with all ,Corps to assist with accurate statistical reporting
Prepare necessary forms for annual Program Reviews and Membership Roll Revisions.
Assist with preparation of reports for the Annual Command Review.
Assist with preparation of the Annual Divisional Report.
Develop and maintain databases and data systems, reorganizing data in a readable format.
Filter data by reviewing reports and identifying any statistical recording errors.
Prepare final analysis reports for DHQ departments and Corps, enabling them to make decisions based on various facts and trends.
Other duties as assigned by supervisor.

Qualifications

High School diploma or GED required: some college preferred.
Statistical analysis experience/education required.
Two to five years of clerical experience preferred.
Ability to manipulate statistical data to generate reports.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and IBM Notes applications.
Strong math skills to help collect, measure, organize, and analyze data.
Ability to work well under pressure and meet competing deadlines.

Good storytelling starts with great listening. At Audible, that means each role and every project has our audience in mind. Because the same people who design, develop, and deploy our products also happen to use them. To us, that speaks volumes.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
Audible seeks a Data Scientist who will help our product, marketing, and content teams target customers and prospects as well as understand and personalize the content, format and context needed to optimize their book-listening experience.

In this role, you will make the best of your skillset in predictive modeling and business intelligence to explain, quantify, predict and prescribe. You will translate business and financial goals into agile, insightful analytics. You will seek to create value for both stakeholders and customers, and will convey findings in a clear, actionable way to managers and senior leaders.

As a Data Scientist, you will...

Develop models to optimize the Who, When, Where and How of all our conversations with customers.
Contribute to the growth of the Audible Data Science team by sharing your ideas, intellectual property and learning from others.

Basic Qualifications


BA/BS in one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Econometrics, Finance.
Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
1+ years of working experience.
Fluent in SQL, Python.

Preferred Qualifications


Passion for data (and fearlessness in the face of a data tsunami), modeling, research design and cutting-edges algorithms.

ABOUT AUDIBLE
At Audible, we innovate and inspire through the power of voice. We're changing the narrative on storytelling. As a leading producer and provider of original spoken-word entertainment and audiobooks, we've redefined the ways people access, discover, and share stories. The stories we tell have the ability to transport and transform everyday moments into meaningful experiences and it's our people who make Audible's service possible. We're listeners, storytellers, and problem-solvers. Our perspectives and experiences power our ideas and come together in our mission to unleash the power of the spoken word.

Job Summary:
The role will perform research and development of advanced analytics solutions in healthcare. Interact with subject matter experts to uncover important insights and build on concepts in statistics, optimization, and machine learning to improve patient and provider experiences. Identify strategic issues, forms hypothesis, design and conduct analyses, synthesize conclusions into recommendations and presentation materials and conducts follow-up studies.

Position Responsibilities:
Use mathematics, statistics, predictive models, business analysis, and cloud technology to transform high volumes of complex data into advanced analytic solutions.

Understand and document business/clinical needs as well as recommend appropriate IS solutions to deliver the needed data.

Serve as primary data liaison to the business/clinical areas to ensure overall expectations are met or exceeded for all data/reporting needs. Facilitate effective customer engagement through regular applicable governance meetings, rounding, and communications regarding requirements, enhancements and priorities.

Keep abreast of current healthcare trends by attending appropriate meetings and reviewing current literature. Provides market intelligence on a regular basis to operations/product line managers and executives.

Research on how to collect or find raw data that can be transformed into meaningful information.

Position Qualifications Required :Required Experience:
2+ years’ experience applying modern machine learning algorithms (clustering, classification, and regression), statistical methods, and optimization.
Strong skills in SQL, fluency in coding in R and/or Python.
Experience using major cloud platforms such as AWS and/or Azure.
Strong data visualization abilities in Tableau/Qlikview, ggplot etc.
Familiarity with EPIC is preferred.

Required Education:
Master’s Degree in Data science, analytics, mathematics or business.

Training / Certification / Licensure:
Advanced level experience with SQL, NOSQL, Tableau, Azure, R and/or Python and other database tools for research and analysis.

Background & Purpose of the Job

As a Data Scientist, you will be an integral part of the Information and Analytics team supporting the organization to enhance and drive overall top-line sales growth and profitability. This role will also interface with multiple key stakeholders and functional teams.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

In this role, you will be responsible for providing insights to the cross-functional business teams leveraging a variety of internal and external data sets, and advance analytic techniques to create value. This role will also interface with multiple stakeholders and teams on a consistent basis to deliver analytic outputs.

You’re a born leader:The ability to gain stakeholder consensus, build coalitions, and present a vision to the broader organization will be crucial for success.

You’re a dot connector: The ability to formulate hypothesis and draw inferences from different cross functional datasets and generate a story of insights is key.

You’re a story teller: You have ability to transform data into insights which provide very clear direction to stakeholders on what actions are needed to drive transformation in the business.

You’re a culture & change champion: Success is dependent upon fostering a highly collaborative and team-oriented environment

Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches, a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data. Analyze data, run descriptive statistics, generate prior distributions, explore relationships: correlation, covariance, causality, regression modeling, and build Bayesian Influence diagrams. Must be hands-on and must have worked on implementing data mining algorithms, work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. Strong experience in Data Visualization, Presentation and Story Telling. Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Partner with business, Data Scientists, and Engineers to create POCs/Pilots, demonstrate thought leadership and generate marketing insights.

What You’ll Need to Succeed

Required:

Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Applied Science, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical field)
A minimum of 1-2 years of data science experience
Expertise in Machine Learning (ML), Data Science, AI, and Data Mining is required.
Expertise in Data Wrangling, Engineering, Exploratory data analysis using statistics and programing
Expertise in ML algorithms such as PCA, LASSO, RIDGE, SVM, Bayesian, Random Forest, Boosting, Clustering, ARMA, Time Series modeling, Generalized Linear Models, Regression Models, Neural Networks, RNN, CNN, and LSTM is required
Expertise in building models using Python, PySpark, Scala, SQL, R
Active listening skills and deep analytical ability are required
A passion for excellence and exceeding customer expectations is required

Preferred

PhD in a related field (e.g. Applied Science, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical field)
Consumer goods experience
Preferred experience in Classification, Forecasting, Anomaly detection, Outliers analysis, Optimization, Trends analysis, Bayesian inference, Time-Series methods (ARMA/ARIMA), Markovian processes
Preferred experience in Java, C++, SAS, SPSS, Azure, Big Data, AWS
Preferred experience in Text Mining and Natural Language Programming (NLP)

Who we are
Cross River is a highly profitable fast-growing financial technology company that helps clients to deliver financial solutions that empower consumers anytime, everywhere. We are on a mission to build the infrastructure that propels access, inclusion, and the democratization of financial services. Our clients include companies such as Affirm, Stripe, Coinbase, and many others.
We are now committed to build products for companies who want to bring crypto to the next 1B people: we are uniquely positioned to succeed because of our technology, experience, and strong relationships with market participants and regulators.
In addition, Cross River offers amongst the best benefits in the industry: Family Medical Plans with minimal outlay to the employee, generous time off, matching 401K, pre-IPO equity, flexible and hybrid work culture, a shuttle from Manhattan to the office, and many more perks and amenities.
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
We are hiring a Data Scientist for our Crypto Research who can perform hands-on analysis and modeling with on-chain and market data to develop insights for primers, whitepapers, dashboards, internal and external presentations.
The ideal candidate has a background in a quantitative or technical field, working with large data sets, and creating dashboards for internal and external usage. You should also be knowledgeable about data, transactions, and models in crypto; you should be able to evaluate a protocol, predict the price of bitcoin, or perform an in/out flow analysis.
You will join an exciting, newly formed, crypto team that deeply cares about growing with people who question assumptions, have strong judgement, execute fast, take ownership, act responsibly, help the team advance and improve its standards.
Responsibilities
You will produce market surveillance insights and dashboards (ie, in/out flow of money, trading signals, macro events, new dynamics, etc.). You will perform sell-side quantitative research and protocol-level analysis. You will identify and engage with new players in Blockchain, Crypto, DeFi. You will establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large-scale data analysis, machine-learning model development, model validation and serving.
Minimum qualifications

2+ years of practical experience as data scientist in a production environment
Experience in at least one programming language (e.g. R, Python, Java, Ruby, Scala/Spark)
Knowledge of self-service analytics tools (e.g., PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau)
Understanding and knowledge of on/off-chain data

Bonus

Experience analyzing new blockchain protocols and develop a thoughtful point of view that leads to a clear recommendation
Experience producing thoughtful and credible research (ie, personal blog, company research, etc.)
Experience presenting research to large audience (webinar, conferences, etc.)
